cluster_relations.rel_desc: The underside of leaves is a specific surface region of plant leaves.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The newly emerged butterfly possesses wings that are in a soft, wrinkled state.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Biological Structures and Substances in Butterfly Metamorphosis

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: immediately after emerging from the chrysalis

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject entity is a constituent or component part of the object entity.
args.justification: This relation connects 'underside of leaves' to 'plant leaves' with a clear part-to-whole direction; the canonical predicate should consistently represent a part pointing to its whole.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject entity includes the object entity as one of its constituent parts.
args.justification: This relation connects 'newly emerged butterfly' to 'soft, wrinkled wings' with a whole-to-part direction; the canonical predicate should represent an entity possessing a component part.
Both relations describe structural composition between entities (part vs. whole), differing only in directionality; they belong in the same part-whole relation class.
Part-whole / has-part relations are a form of compositional structure, where one entity is composed of or includes another.
